channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Murdoch Family Is Battling Over the Future of the Fox Empire
item.description: Rupert Murdoch, the patriarch, has moved to change the family’s irrevocable trust to preserve his media businesses as a conservative force. Several of his children are fighting back.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Netanyahu’s Speech to Congress Disappoints Many Israelis
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who has been facing anger from Israelis over the fate of the hostages, met with President Biden on Thursday at the White House.

item.title: Chipotle CEO says ‘generous portions’ will become standard after people blasted its skimpy serving sizes on social media
item.description: Brian Niccol said roughly 10% of Chipotle’s restaurants are outliers in terms of portion sizes.

item.title: California Supreme Court Upholds Gig-Worker Proposition
item.description: Passed by voters in 2020, the ballot measure classifies Uber and Lyft drivers as independent contractors rather than as employees.

item.title: Martin S. Indyk, Diplomat Who Sought Middle East Peace, Dies at 73
item.description: As ambassador to Israel in the Clinton administration and as a special envoy under Barack Obama, he was skeptical of Israeli settlements.

item.title: The ultra-rich are scooping up mansions while almost no one else can afford a typical home
item.description: Luxury-home prices rose more than twice as fast as non-luxury homes, and still their sales jumped compared to typical homes, according to Redfin.

item.title: Southwest Airlines Will End Its Longstanding Open-Seating Policy
item.description: The airline said it was scrapping its trademark, 50-year tradition of offering open seating, where passengers choose seats once they have boarded the plane.

item.title: Israeli Officials Retrieve the Bodies of 5 Hostages From Gaza
item.description: The military said that the bodies had been found in the Khan Younis area and that intelligence, including information from detained Palestinian militants, had led its forces to them.

item.title: The 10 best prepaid debit cards you can get without a credit score
item.description: No checking account? No problem. These prepaid debit cards let you add funds and swipe to pay without a ton of fees.

item.title: Trump Workshops Jabs at Harris, but Nothing Plays Like the Classics
item.description: Donald J. Trump began turning Vice President Kamala Harris, his new opponent, into a nemesis. But his crowd still wanted to hear the hits.

item.title: In Burkina Faso, ‘Nowhere Is Safe’ from Terrorists or Troops
item.description: The West African nation of Burkina Faso was once known for its lively arts scene. Now, it is a country torn apart by Islamist extremists and the government’s brutal effort to drive them out.

item.title: Biles, Osaka, Richardson Olympic comebacks highlight issues facing people like them: ‘We’re still asking a lot of Black women athletes’
item.description: They've all bounced back to the world's biggest stage while displaying different levels of vulnerability.

item.title: In Burkina Faso, ‘Nowhere Is Safe’ from Terrorists or Troops
item.description: The West African nation of Burkina Faso was once known for its lively arts scene. Now, it is a country torn apart by Islamist extremists and the government’s brutal effort to drive them out.

item.title: The Taxidermy Bat Market Is Compounding Threats to a Species’ Existence
item.description: Online sales appear to be compounding threats from climate change and habitat loss, according to new research.

item.title: Department of Homeland Security to use robot dogs in raids
